content.question: Based on the passage, Ortega y Gasset most likely held which of the following views of modern European art and literature?

choices.label: Governments’ use of modern art for propaganda purposes offered artists an appealing new mode of expression.
Modern artists’ focus on the subconscious and the subjective had distracted them from their proper role as critics of society’s injustices.
In rejecting accepted aesthetic standards and literary conventions, modern art had become unmoored from its foundation.
The growing internationalism in literature, art, and architecture had severed the connection between modern art and its national roots.

content.answer: In rejecting accepted aesthetic standards and literary conventions, modern art had become unmoored from its foundation.
